intro: Solenostigma wightii, commonly known as the Himalayan sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in rocky or alpine environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Solenostigma wightii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens at high altitudes.
